sen.j: 入母屋造が神社建築に採用されたことに付いて、仏教建築からの一方的な影響のみがあったのではなく、神社建築としての価値観に基づいて、受身的ではなく主体的に採用したことが、同じ仏教建築の様式であるが妻のない寄棟造や方形造を採用しなかったことから分かる。
sen.e: As can be noticed from not applying non-gabled styles such as yosemune-zukuri or hougyo-zukuri, the irimoya-zukuri is considered to have been adopted as an architectural style of shrines willingly while maintaining the values of shinto shrine architecture, rather than passively influenced by buddhist styles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理。主体的に→「進んで」 Willinglyと意訳しました。
sen.e: As can be seen from the lack of non-gabled styles such as yosemune-zukuri or hougyo-zukuri, the irimoya-zukuri is considered to have been willingly adopted as an architectural style maintaining the values of Shinto shrine architecture, over passively influenced Buddhist styles.

sen.e: Tate-haiden serves as a passageway to the honden, and the space toward the end of the long axis of the haiden serves as heiden, or offering hall.

sen.j: 拝殿が成立する以前の回廊形式だったころの幣殿が変化したものとも考えられる。
sen.e: The corridor style heiden, which had been common in old times before haiden was established, is believed to have been developed into tate-haiden.

sen.j: 割拝殿
sen.e: Wari-haiden (literally, a divided prayer hall)

sen.j: 中央が吹き抜けになっていて、左右に床間がある。
sen.e: A structure in which there is a passageway in the center with vaulted ceilings, and there are raised timber floor rooms in both sides separated by the passageway.

sen.j: これは回廊形式の中門と左右の回廊が変形した結果だと考えられる。
sen.e: It is considered that the chumon, or middle gate and the corridors on the right and left in the corridor style structure were developed into the form of wari-haiden.

sen.j: 遺構は少なく大神神社・石上神宮摂社出雲建男神社・大崎八幡宮に見られる。
sen.e: Today there are only few structures that retain the form of warihaiden style, such as: Omiwa-jinja Shrine, Isonokami Jingu Sessha Izumo Takeo-jinja Shrine, and Osaki Hachimangu Shrine.
